ABSTRACT Buzzi Fern√° ndez, Ana. C ore derivatives [1]benzothieno[3,2 -b]benzothiophene: influence on molecular orientation, the process of charge transfer and its application in optoelectronic devices. Rio de Janeiro, 2019. Tese (Doutorado em Qu√≠mica) -- Instituto de Qu√≠mica, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, 2019.

Currently, several research groups have dedicated their studies to optimize the structures of organic compounds to be used in the construction of optoelectronic devices. Among the derivatives of the core [1 ]benzothieno[3,2 -b]benzothiophene (BTBT) are some of the molecular semiconductors with the highest mobility values obtained until today. One way of modifying the charge transport properties is through the addition of alkyl chains. In this work, we analyzed three derivatives of the BTBT core: 2,7 -di-iso- propyl[1]benzothieno[3,2 -b]benzothiophene (diiPr -BTBT), 2,7 -di-tert- butyl[1]benzothieno[3,2 -b]benzothiophene (ditBu -BTBT) and 2,7 -di-tert- pentyl[1]benzothieno[3,2 -b]benzothiophene (di(Me) 2Pr-BTBT).

Using near -edge X -ray absorption fine structure (NEXAFS) and resonant Auger spectroscopy (RAS) in conjunction with the core -hole clock methodology the electronic structure, molecular ordering and orientation and charge transfer dynamics in the femtosecond time scale were studied for the oligomers films. The ditBu -BTBT film showed the highest molecular order (up -right orientation) in both the surface and the bulk of the material. Also, shorter charge transfer time was obtained for the ditBu -BTBT film. Thin oligomer fi lms were evaluated by UV -vis, XPS, UPS, REELS, cyclic voltammetry and electroluminescence techniques. As a result of the characterization, an energetic diagram was attempted for the diiPr -BTBT and ditBu -BTBT films, as well as the HOMO and LUMO levels of th e di(Me) 2Pr-BTBT film. The construction of optoelectronic devices (OLEDs) including the oligomers as emitter layers was carried out without conclusive results on the electroluminescence of the materials. A successful device was built where the oligomer di(Me) 2Pr-BTBT was used as a hole transporting layer.
Keywords: Thiophene oligomers. XPS. NEXAFS. Core -hole clock methodology. Organic light emitting diodes.
